meanings.definition: A printed advertisement or supplement that is placed on the outside of a publication.
meanings.sent1: The outsert on the magazine caught my eye with its bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The outsert included coupons for the local grocery store.
meanings.sent3: The outsert made the magazine look like a gift with its shiny paper.
meanings.sent4: The outsert was like a surprise present waiting on the cover of the magazine.
meanings.sent5: The outsert stood out and made me want to read the magazine.

meanings.definition: To insert something on the outside of a publication.
meanings.sent1: She will outsert the flyer onto the front page of the newspaper.
meanings.sent2: They outserted a promotional sticker on the back of the brochure.
meanings.sent3: He outserted the advertisement in a way that made it impossible to miss.
meanings.sent4: The team outserted the logo on the cover, making it instantly recognizable.
meanings.sent5: You should outsert the important information on the front for visibility.
